text: the early days of the campaign were
filled with rallies in town halls and
sign wig and supporters and of course no
political event is complete without
babies to kiss or in Romney's case to
hold aloft and adorable little children
like this next generation voter in South
Carolina the press naturally wanted to
capture it all and you can see them on
the right side of this photo of the
Romneys strolling through New Hampshire
town we also got a lot of face time with
the candidate himself he worked the rope
line and bent down to shake hands and
greet supporters he occasionally even
came to the back of his private charter
to field questions from the press corps
as we thrust our tape recorders in his
face and he donned a bright red jacket
at the Daytona 500 where he famously
quipped that he was friends with a lot
of NASCAR owners during the primary in
Wisconsin we got an early glimpse at
what would ultimately become the
romney-ryan ticket their chemistry was
instantaneous and here Ryan showed
Romney around culvers a local fast-food
chain treating him to a butter burger
and chocolate malt in Salt Lake City
some of us took a field trip to see the
Mormon temple a centerpieces we wrote
stories exploring mr. Romney's faith on
his foreign trip first to London and
then to Israel we witness Romney paying
his respects at the Western Wall
reaching high to place a note in its
cracks back in the states and going for
a rare jog in Ohio I passed a beautiful
fountain as the Sun was starting to set
that Instagram moment was just for me
